name: How to Make a French 75
instructions: Shake gin, sugar, and lemon juice well with cracked ice in a chilled cocktail shaker.
Strain into a Collins glass half-full of cracked ice.
Top off with champagne.

name: How to Make a Honey Bee
instructions: Stir honey with warm water in a cocktail shaker until the honey is thoroughly dissolved.
Add the rum and lemon juice, then shake with cracked ice.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: How to Make a Gin Rickey
instructions: Squeeze the juice from half a lime into a highball glass filled with ice cubes. Drop the lime half in the glass.
Pour in the gin, then fill the rest of the glass with club soda. Stir.

name: How to Make the Ultimate Mojito
instructions: In a smallish Collins glass, muddle lime juice with 1/2 to 1 tsp. superfine sugar.
Add the mint leaves, mushing them against the side of the glass.
Fill glass 2/3 with cracked ice and pour in the rum.
Pitch in the squeezed-out lime shell and top off with club soda or seltzer.

name: How to Make a Tom Collins
instructions: Shake lemon juice, simple syrup, and gin with ice.
Strain into a Collins glass over ice.
Top with soda water, and garnish with lemon and cocktail cherry.

name: How to Make a Daiquiri
instructions: Squeeze the lime into your shaker, stir in the sugar, and then add the rum.
Shake well with cracked ice, then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: How to Make a Manhattan
instructions: Stir the whiskey, vermouth, and bitters well with cracked ice in a mixing glass until chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a twist and/or a cocktail cherry.

name: How to Make a Classic Martini Like a Pro
instructions: Fill a metal shaker with cracked ice.
Pour in the dry vermouth, stir briefly, and strain out (this may be discarded).
Add 4 ounces of gin. Stir briskly for about 10 seconds.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and garnish with olives or a lemon twist.

name: How to Make a French 75
instructions: Shake gin, sugar, and lemon juice well with cracked ice in a chilled cocktail shaker.
Strain into a Collins glass half-full of cracked ice.
Top off with champagne.

name: How to Make a Tom Collins
instructions: Shake lemon juice, simple syrup, and gin with ice.
Strain into a Collins glass over ice.
Top with soda water, and garnish with lemon and cocktail cherry.

name: How to Make a Dirty Martini
instructions: Combine the gin, vermouth, and olive juice in a mixing tin with ice. Stir well.
Strain into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with as many olives as you'd like on a toothpick.

name: How to Make a Vesper
instructions: Stir ingredients briskly with ice in a mixing tin until very cold.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a large, thin-cut lemon peel.

name: How to Make a Sloe Gin Fizz
instructions: Shake well with cracked ice in a chilled cocktail shaker.
Strain into a small, chilled Collins glass and fizz to an inch from the top—use a soda siphon if you've got one, or splash the club soda in rather carelessly, so that it foams.

name: How to Make a Vodka Martini
instructions: Stir the ingredients well with ice, then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist (or an olive).

name: How to Make a Classic Mimosa
instructions: Fill champagne flute 1/3 full of fresh-squeezed orange juice.
Top up with brut champagne.
Add the teaspoon of Grand Marnier.

name: How to Make the Ultimate Mojito
instructions: In a smallish Collins glass, muddle lime juice with 1/2 to 1 tsp. superfine sugar.
Add the mint leaves, mushing them against the side of the glass.
Fill glass 2/3 with cracked ice and pour in the rum.
Pitch in the squeezed-out lime shell and top off with club soda or seltzer.

name: How to Make a Moscow Mule
instructions: Squeeze lime juice into a copper mug (or a Collins glass) and drop in the spent shell.
Add ice cubes, then pour in the vodka and fill with cold ginger beer.
Serve with a stirring rod.

name: How to Make a Silver Fizz
instructions: Shake ingredients (except club soda) furiously with cracked ice in a chilled cocktail shaker.
Strain into a Collins glass and fill up with club soda. Serve with a stirring rod.

name: How to Make an Air Mail
instructions: Stir rum, lime juice, and honey thoroughly with cracked ice in a chilled cocktail shaker.
Pour unstrained into a Collins glass.
Top with champagne

name: How to Make a Dark and Stormy
instructions: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes. Add rum.
Pour in ginger beer and lime juice.
Stir with a barspoon.
Garnish with a lime wedge. Enjoy.

name: How to Make a Sazerac
instructions: In an Old-Fashioned glass, muddle a sugar cube with a few drops of water.
Add several small ice cubes, then rye whiskey, Peychaud's bitters, and Angostura bitters. Stir well.
Roll a few drops of absinthe around a second, chilled Old-Fashioned glass until its inside is thoroughly coated. Pour off the excess.
Strain the contents of the first glass into the second. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel.

name: How to Make a Cuba Libre
instructions: Squeeze a lime into a Collins glass. Add 2 or 3 ice cubes.
Pour in the rum.
Drop in one of the spent lime shells and fill with cold Coca-Cola.
Stir briefly.

name: How to Make a Whiskey Sour
instructions: Shake the whiskey, juice, sugar, and egg whites well with cracked ice.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry and/or lemon wedge.

name: How to Make a Classic Martini Like a Pro
instructions: Fill a metal shaker with cracked ice.
Pour in the dry vermouth, stir briefly, and strain out (this may be discarded).
Add 4 ounces of gin. Stir briskly for about 10 seconds.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and garnish with olives or a lemon twist.

name: How to Make the Best Old Fashioned Cocktail
instructions: Place the sugar cube in an Old Fashioned glass.
Wet it down with Angostura bitters and a short splash of club soda.
Crush the sugar with a wooden muddler, then rotate the glass so that the sugar grains and bitters give it a lining.
Add a large ice cube. Pour in the whiskey.
Garnish with an orange twist, and serve with a stirring rod if you're so inclined.

name: How to Make a Gin and Tonic
instructions: Add the gin to a highball glass filled with ice.
Squeeze in lime wedges to taste.
Then add tonic water and stir to combine.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

name: How to Make a Tom Collins
instructions: Shake lemon juice, simple syrup, and gin with ice.
Strain into a Collins glass over ice.

name: How to Make a Gin Rickey
instructions: Squeeze the juice from half a lime into a highball glass filled with ice cubes. Drop the lime half in the glass.
Pour in the gin, then fill the rest of the glass with club soda. Stir.

name: How to Make a Mint Julep
instructions: Place mint leaves in the bottom of a pre-chilled, dry pewter cup. Add sugar and crush slightly with a muddler.
Pack glass with finely cracked ice, then pour a generous 3 ounces of Kentucky bourbon over the ice.
Stir briskly until the glass frosts.
Add more ice and stir again before serving. Stick a few sprigs of mint into the ice to get the aroma.

name: How to Make a Cape Codder
instructions: Pour vodka, cranberry juice, and lime juice into a Collins glass over ice. Stir.
Top with club soda, then garnish with a lime wedge.

name: How to Make a Gin Gimlet
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with cracked ice.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and garnish with a lime.

name: How to Make a Caipirinha
instructions: Slice the lime into 1/2-inch rounds, cube them, and muddle them in an Old-Fashioned glass with the sugar.
Add a couple of ice cubes.
Pour in the cachaça.
Serve with a stirring rod.

name: How to Make a Daiquiri
instructions: Squeeze the lime into your shaker, stir in the sugar, and then add the rum.
Shake well with cracked ice, then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: How to Make a Highball
instructions: Fill the tall, narrow-mouthed glass with ice cubes.
Pour your chosen liquor over the ice.
Hold the glass at a slight angle and slowly pour the club soda into it. No need to stir. Garnish with citrus (optional).

name: How to Make a Champagne Cocktail
instructions: Place a sugar cube in a chilled champagne flute, lash it with 2 or 3 dashes of bitters, and fill the glass with brut champagne.
Squeeze a lemon twist on top, then use as garnish.

name: How to Make a Whiskey Spritz
instructions: Combine whisky and aperitif in glass.
Add 2 large ice cubes, cracked.
Stir.
Add apricot brandy and more cracked ice, almost to the top.
Add sparkling wine and club soda.
Stir again.
Garnish with expressed and rolled grapefruit peel and half a strawberry.

name: How to Make a White Russian
instructions: Shake well with cracked ice, then strain into a chilled Old-Fashioned glass (it'll look less wicked than in a martini glass; that's important).
Some folks build this one on the rocks, floating the cream on top. No.

name: How to Make an Aviation Cocktail
instructions: Shake gin, maraschino liqueur, and lemon juice well with cracked ice.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Serve ungarnished.

name: How to Make a Rum Sour
instructions: Add the lemon juice to a shaker, stir in the sugar, and then add the rum.
Shake well with cracked ice, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: How to Make a Margarita
instructions: Chill a cocktail glass, and then rub its rim with lime juice and dip it in coarse salt.
Add tequila, Cointreau, lime juice, and ice together in a cocktail shaker.
Shake and then strain into the glass over ice.

name: How to Make a Cobbler-Style Rye Whiskey Cocktail
instructions: Combine all ingredients into a shaker tin. Vigorously shake for 12 seconds.
Fine strain over crushed ice.
Garnish with a twist of lemon and a gingersnap cookie.

instructions: Shake gin, maraschino liqueur, and lemon juice well with cracked ice.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Serve ungarnished.

name: How to Make Irish Coffee
instructions: Pour the whiskey, coffee, and sugar into a stemmed, heated glass mug.
Stir, then top off with a thick layer of lightly whipped heavy cream. Don't stir it in.*

name: How to Make a Zombie
instructions: Stir together all the ingredients except the 151.
Pour the mixture into a 14-ounce glass three-fourths full of cracked ice.
Float the 151 as a lid by pouring it into a spoon and gently dipping it under the surface of the drink.*
Garnish with mint (either straight or dipped in lime juice and then superfine sugar) and/or fruit.

name: How to Make a Mai Tai
instructions: Shake ingredients with cracked ice in a chilled cocktail shaker.
Pour unstrained into a large Collins glass (or tiki mug).
Garnish with half a lime shell and a sprig of mint.

name: How to Make a Mint Julep
instructions: Place mint leaves in the bottom of a pre-chilled, dry pewter cup. Add sugar and crush slightly with a muddler.
Pack glass with finely cracked ice, then pour a generous 3 ounces of Kentucky bourbon over the ice.
Stir briskly until the glass frosts.
Add more ice and stir again before serving. Stick a few sprigs of mint into the ice to get the aroma.

name: How to Make a Piña Colada
instructions: Combine rum with unsweetened pineapple juice (you can sub in 3 ounces crushed or whole pineapple) and coconut cream* in a blender.
Blend on high with a cup or so of crushed ice, or 5 to 6 ice cubes.
Pour into a tall glass. Garnish with whatever you've got. Cherry. Pineapple. Fruit.
